name: market for lignite | lignite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19202/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'lignite', in the geography of India.;Average Transport distance specific for the country has been used. Handling and Transit Losses has been used in the dataset.   ;The major modes of transport of coal in India are Railways, Road (use of lorries), Merry Go Round Systems (MGR), Belt or Pipe Conveyor. The majority of the coal transportation is handled by Railways which contributes to almost 52 % of the overall coal transport in india. Coal transported through road is around 26 % while merry go round system contributes around 18.48 %. Belt conveyor contributes to around 1.55 % of overall transportation;lignite' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 8.8 MJ/kg. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from lignite mines. Its main applications are in the following sectors: domestic heating and agriculture.

The activity starts with 1 kg lignite at mines ready to be transported to various industries

This module includes transport of lignite from mines to various industries Losses are included.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/052:Mining of lignite/0520:Mining of lignite

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average distance calculated between mines and their dispacth location.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: All the major lignite producing companies in india have their own thermal power plants in india. The lignite is transported from these mines to the respective coal based power plants through belt conveyors.

flow.name: lignite
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/052:Mining of lignite/0520:Mining of lignite

exchanges.description: Value taken from "market for hard coal"/GLO (accessed 20170824). The activities are similar in nature hence the values for emissions have been taken from the above mentioned dataset.

Value taken from "market for hard coal"/GLO (accessed 20170824). The activities are similar in nature hence the values for emissions have been taken from the above mentioned dataset.
Value taken from "market for hard coal"/GLO (accessed 20170824). The activities are similar in nature hence the values for emissions have been taken from the above mentioned dataset.

Own Assumption. Lignite in India is mainly used for power generation. All the major power plants are located just near to the Lignite mines. The major source of lignite transport for these sites is usually through belt conveyors. For approximation 80 % of total lignite is considered to be transported through bet conveyors with approximate distance of 5 kms , 10 % of lignite is considered to be transported through roads with approximate distance of 25 kms. The remaining 10 % lignite is considered to be transported through merry go round trains with a average distance of 25 kms.
